entry.title: Achaemenid royal inscriptions (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Achaemenid royal inscriptions (one pictured) at Persepolis allowed for the initial decipherment of cuneiform?

entry.title: George Wythe Baylor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Confederate troops under Colonel George Wythe Baylor disabled two Union tinclad gunboats on the Red River in Louisiana on May 5, 1864?

entry.title: Iraqi Communist Party – Central Command (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during a guerrilla campaign in 1968, the Iraqi Communist Party – Central Command attacked the house of Saddam Hussein?

entry.title: Rahudman Harahap (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Medan under Rahudman Harahap attempted a crackdown on pig farms within city limits, but backed down after local opposition?

entry.title: Capital Classic (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Michael Jordan was fired by the Washington Wizards, he wanted to move the Capital Classic from the Washington, D.C., area to New York?

entry.title: Marie-Julien Dunand (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after a riot destroyed some local churches, Marie-Julien Dunand, a French missionary in China, ordered the construction of the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception in Chengdu and Annunciation Seminary in Pengzhou?

entry.title: an American version (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that there was an American version of the Eurovision Song Contest, but it was not renewed for a 2023 season?

entry.title: Rosa Smester Marrero (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rosa Smester Marrero said that without women, men would live the life of a turnip?
